intro: Malouetia brachyloba, commonly known as the short-lobed malouetia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
